title: Paccar, Under Armour, Ford, United: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
sub_head: Technology shares are leading gains in futures markets
body:
Here’s what we’re watching ahead of the opening bell Thursday.
—Futures tied to the S&P 500 edged up less than 0.1%. Nasdaq-100 futures added 0.2%. The dollar and oil prices are down. Read our full market wrap here.
—About 900,000 workers filed for unemployment benefits last week. The data suggest the labor market is struggling to recover this winter amid elevated coronavirus cases, tightened business restrictions and a wary public.
— Intel , IBM and CSX are due to report earnings after markets close.
—Weekly data on claims for jobless benefits will show whether the labor market is starting to stabilize or deteriorating further. Economists reckon around 925,000 workers filed for benefits, holding steady after claims jumped at the start of the year. The figures are due at 8:30 a.m. ET.
